name: Legendre's conjecture
rephrased: For every positive integer n, there is at least one prime number between n² and (n+1)².
implication_form: If n is a positive integer, then there exists a prime number between n² and (n+1)².
explained: Legendre's conjecture states that for every positive integer n, there exists at least one prime number p such that n² < p < (n+1)².
related_conjectures: Bertrand's postulate (which guarantees a prime between n and 2n)
Goldbach conjecture (concerning even numbers as sums of primes)
Prime number theorem (describing the asymptotic distribution of primes)
